abstract: Federal appeals court in Manhattan rules immigrants convicted of crimes that are considered removable offenses cannot be held in detention longer than six months without bail hearing; previously, non-citizens awaiting an immigration hearing could be held for unlimited amount of time; decision could affect hundreds of immigrants in New York City area alone.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court in New York ruled that some immigrants detained in deportation cases cannot be held longer than six months without a bail hearing.

headline.main: Court Sets Limit on Holding Immigrants in Some Deportation Cases
headline.print_headline: Court Sets Limit on Holding Immigrants in Criminal Cases
